channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This startup uses plants—not a huge mine—to pull a critical mineral out of the ground
item.description: In South Africa, a field covered in yellow wildflowers doesn’t look like an industrial site. But it’s a pilot for a new type of nickel mine: Instead o...

item.title: Ray Dalio says the world is running out of interest in buying U.S. debt—but America is unable to cut back its spending
item.description: But Dalio, speaking at the Future China Global Forum in Singapore this week, doesn't think the U.S. is in a position to pull back on its spending.

item.title: 5 Brain Implant Companies Developing New Ways to Treat Disease
item.description: These pioneers are aiming to do challenging and important medical work. One has already implanted 54 patients.

item.title: Nvidia and the U.S. Government Both Have Stakes in Intel Now
item.description: Intel stock surged after announcing a $5 billion deal with Nvidia.

item.title: Trump may use tariff revenue to bail out farmers, agriculture secretary says. They’re reeling from challenges caused by the levies to begin with
item.description: Subsidies to farmers in rural America may ease their financial troubles, but the erosion of agricultural markets as a result of tariffs will remain, o...

item.title: BMW’s new rebrand is so quiet you might miss it
item.description: BMW just made a subtle change to the logo on its latest car. The German automaker simplified the roundel on its new, fully electric BMW iX3 by removin...

item.title: The AI company creating a customized ChatGPT for your business
item.description: When Glean CEO Arvind Jain thinks about the future of work, he doesn’t picture a chatbot waiting for you to type a question. He imagines a digital com...

item.title: What to Say to Your Kids About AI
item.description: Parents are sticking their heads in the sand about their kids’ AI use. Experts say they should experiment with AI together instead.

item.title: How Sephora is taking partnerships far beyond the storefront
item.description: In early September, when beauty retailer Sephora launched sales of Rhode , a line of skincare products from Haley Bieber, customers were more than rea...

item.title: How Chasing Profitability Has Crippled the Tech Industry in 2025
item.description: This is largely a case of: Don’t fix the problem, just give me something new to complain about.

item.title: Gen Z college grads are flocking to Texas and Florida where companies have ‘overwhelmingly’ relocated their headquarters
item.description: These markets are becoming nearly as popular as New York and San Francisco.

item.title: Seeing Is Believing: How a Rare Surgery Can Reverse Blindness
item.description: An innovative tooth-in-eye surgery helped a patient regain his eyesight after two decades. It’s exactly what it sounds like.

item.title: The great AI commerce startup opportunity, according to Andreessen Horowitz
item.description: A16Z's Alex Rampell and Justine Moore go deep on the ramifications of rapidly changing consumer behavior.

item.title: The Fed’s cut was ‘more hawkish than anticipated,’ Moody’s Zandi says — and warns it won’t be enough to stave off a looming jobs recession
item.description: The market didn’t get the dovish signal it was looking for.

item.title: ‘I can hear their breathing’: Why Gen Z doesn’t say ‘hello’ when answering the phone
